Detailed Description

Function Documentation

static void execute ( char *  line) [static]

Executes a line of brainfuck code.

line must be a valid brainfuck program. exits with error if there is a bracket that wants us to jump but there is no matching bracket.

Parameters:
linethe brainfuck code we want to execute.
Returns:
Void.
static char* getline ( char *  start) [static]

Gets a single line of input from the terminal.

Will call realloc to dynamically resize a string to get all the input. Will exit with an error if call to realloc fails. start is a char buffer with length at least chunklen + 1.

Parameters:
startthe buffer we want to use to copy the line of text into.
Returns:
The line of text read in from the terminal.
static char* getprog ( FILE *  file,
char *  start 
) [static]

Reads all the text from file into a char buffer.

Will call realloc to dynamically resize a string to get all the input. Will exit with an error if call to realloc fails. start is a char buffer with length at least chunklen + 1.

Parameters:
filethe file we want to read input from.
startthe buffer we want to use to copy the file text into.
Returns:
The text read in from file.
static jumpstack* init_jumpstack ( void  ) [static]

Initializes a new jumpstack.

Will exit with an error if call to calloc fails.

Returns:
The address of a new jumpstack.
static memchunk* init_memchunk ( void  ) [static]

Allocates and initializes a new chunk of memory.

Will exit with an error if call to calloc or call to malloc fail.

Returns:
The address of a new memchunk.
int main ( int  argc,
char *  argv[] 
)

Runs the brainfuck virtual machine.

Usage: $ bfvm Sets up the vm and starts the interpreter. Every line passed to the interpreter must be a valid brainfuck program, not just part of one.

$ bfvm filename Reads in the input file and executes it, then starts the interpreter.

Parameters:
argcthe number of arguments.
argvthe array of arguments.
Returns:
Success status
static char* match_right ( char *  line) [static]

Finds the next valid right bracket.

*line is a left bracket. search to the right to find the next unmatched right bracket.

Parameters:
linethe string in which we want to find a matching right bracket.
Returns:
the address of the right bracket if it exists, NULL otherwise.
static memchunk* overflow_left ( memchunk *  chunk) [static]

Adds on more memory to the left of chunk.

Parameters:
chunkthe address of the current memchunk the vm is using.
Returns:
The address of the new memchunk the vm will be using.
static memchunk* overflow_right ( memchunk *  chunk) [static]

Adds on more memory to the right of chunk.

Parameters:
chunkthe address of the current memchunk the vm is using.
Returns:
The address of the new memchunk the vm will be using.
static jumpstack* pop_jump ( jumpstack *  stack) [static]

Pops the top address off of stack.

Parameters:
stackThe address of the jumpstack we want to pop the top off of.
Returns:
The resulting jumpstack after popping the top off of stack.
static jumpstack* push_jump ( jumpstack *  stack,
char *  leftbracket 
) [static]

Pushes on the address of a left bracket onto stack.

Parameters:
stackThe address of the jumpstack we want to push leftbracket on.
leftbracketThe address of the left bracket we want to store.
Returns:
The resulting jumpstack from pushing leftbracket onto stack
